Key Match Events: Kyle Higashioka's solo homer started a five-run rally against an ailing Max Fried with two outs in the second inning
Manny Machado added a two-run double with the bases loaded
Jackson Merrill, a top contender for NL Rookie of the Year, followed with a two-run triple
Post-Match Reflections: The Padres, who would love to win a World Series title in memory of late owner Peter Seidler, head up Interstate 5 to face Shohei Ohtani and the NL West rival and top-seeded Los Angeles Dodgers in a National League Division Series beginning Saturday evening at Dodger Stadium
Miscellaneous Highlights: San Diego eliminated the 111-win Dodgers in a 2022 NLDS
Others: Robert Suarez pitched a perfect ninth for the save
Former Yankee Kyle Higashioka hit a solo home run during the second inning of the Padres’ 5-4 NL Wild Card clinching win over the Braves on Oct. 2, 2024
After the Padres took a 5-1 lead in the second, Jorge Soler hit a solo homer in the fifth and Michael Harris II had a two-run shot in the eighth
Dylan Lee took over for Atlanta to start the third

Robert Suarez pitched a perfect ninth for the save as soon as Higashioka caught pinch-hitter Travis d’Arnaud’s foul pop for the final out — the catcher had to step over first baseman Donovan Solano, who also went for it — the crowd started chanting “Beat L.A.!”
